elements.title: Downscaling micro- and nano-perovskite LEDs
elements.contents:
Downscaling micro- and nano-perovskite LEDs

A process based on perovskite semiconductors is described to downscale micro-LEDs and nano-LEDs to below the conventional size limits, demonstrating average external quantum efficiencies maintained at around 20% across a wide range of pixel lengths.

  • Yaxiao Lian
  • Yaxin Wang
  • Dawei Di
Article19 Mar 2025

elements.title: Fluctuating magnetism and Pomeranchuk effect in multilayer graphene
elements.contents:
Fluctuating magnetism and Pomeranchuk effect in multilayer graphene

Itinerant magnetism in rhombohedral multilayer graphene shows a large excess entropy from magnetic fluctuations above its critical temperature—typically only associated with local moments—which implies the decoupling of charge and isospin degrees of freedom, and results in the isospin Pomeranchuk effect.

  • Ludwig Holleis
  • Tian Xie
  • Andrea F. Young
Article19 Mar 2025

elements.title: Drivers of avian genomic change revealed by evolutionary rate decomposition
elements.contents:
Drivers of avian genomic change revealed by evolutionary rate decomposition

Genomic evolutionary rates are decomposed to identify the dominant lineages and genes driving rate variation across the phylogeny of birds.

  • David A. Duchêne
  • Al-Aabid Chowdhury
  • Simon Y. W. Ho
ArticleOpen Access19 Mar 2025

elements.title: Widespread slow growth of acquisitive tree species
elements.contents:
Widespread slow growth of acquisitive tree species

Under field conditions, acquisitive tree species generally grow slowly, whereas conservative species show generally higher realized growth, owing to their ability to tolerate unfavourable environmental conditions.

  • L. Augusto
  • R. Borelle
  • M. Charru
Article19 Mar 2025

elements.title: A polyene macrolide targeting phospholipids in the fungal cell membrane
elements.contents:
A polyene macrolide targeting phospholipids in the fungal cell membrane

Mandimycin, a polyene macrolide, exhibits strong antifungal activity and possesses a mode of action that is distinct from other compounds of this class.

  • Qisen Deng
  • Yinchuan Li
  • Zongqiang Wang
ArticleOpen Access19 Mar 2025

elements.title: VDAC2 loss elicits tumour destruction and inflammation for cancer therapy
elements.contents:
VDAC2 loss elicits tumour destruction and inflammation for cancer therapy

VDAC2 deficiency elicits uncontrolled IFNγ-induced BAK activation and mitochondrial damage for improved cancer therapy.

  • Sujing Yuan
  • Renqiang Sun
  • Hongbo Chi
ArticleOpen Access19 Mar 2025

elements.title: Regulated somatic hypermutation enhances antibody affinity maturation
elements.contents:
Regulated somatic hypermutation enhances antibody affinity maturation

Germinal centre B cells modify their mutation rate to preserve high-affinity receptors, thereby safeguarding high-affinity B cell lineages and enhancing the outcomes of antibody affinity maturation.

  • Julia Merkenschlager
  • Andrew G. T. Pyo
  • Michel C. Nussenzweig
ArticleOpen Access19 Mar 2025

elements.title: Down-converted photon pairs in a high-Q silicon nitride microresonator
elements.contents:
Down-converted photon pairs in a high-Q silicon nitride microresonator

Spontaneous parametric down-conversion was used to generate narrowband photon pairs with a high spectral brightness in a high-Q silicon nitride microresonator.

  • Bohan Li
  • Zhiquan Yuan
  • Kerry Vahala
ArticleOpen Access19 Mar 2025

elements.title: Convergent vocal representations in parrot and human forebrain motor networks
elements.contents:
Convergent vocal representations in parrot and human forebrain motor networks

Using advanced brain-recording techniques, parrots were found to have a brain organization for vocal control similar to humans, making them an important model for studying speech and for developing potential treatments for communication disorders.

  • Zetian Yang
  • Michael A. Long
Article19 Mar 2025

elements.title: Rapid emergence of latent knowledge in the sensory cortex drives learning
elements.contents:
Rapid emergence of latent knowledge in the sensory cortex drives learning

In mice, learning and performance on an auditory task is driven by higher-order signals in the auditory cortex that are no longer required when the mouse has achieved expert-level performance.

  • Céline Drieu
  • Ziyi Zhu
  • Kishore Kuchibhotla
Article19 Mar 2025

elements.title: Overlapping nuclear import and export paths unveiled by two-colour MINFLUX
elements.contents:
Overlapping nuclear import and export paths unveiled by two-colour MINFLUX

High spatiotemporal precision tracking using 3D MINFLUX shows that nuclear import and export occur in overlapping regions of the central pore, providing insight into transport across the nuclear pore complex.

  • Abhishek Sau
  • Sebastian Schnorrenberg
  • Siegfried M. Musser
ArticleOpen Access19 Mar 2025

elements.title: Structural dynamics of DNA unwinding by a replicative helicase
elements.contents:
Structural dynamics of DNA unwinding by a replicative helicase

Cryo-electron microscopy structures of DNA helicases in various conformations provide insight into an ATP-hydrolysis-dependent ‘entropy switch’ that drives unwinding of DNA for replication, with probable conservation across viral and eukaryotic systems.

  • Taha Shahid
  • Ammar U. Danazumi
  • Alfredo De Biasio
ArticleOpen Access19 Mar 2025

elements.title: Water structure and electric fields at the interface of oil droplets
elements.contents:
Water structure and electric fields at the interface of oil droplets

Raman spectroscopy measurements of water at the interface with oil droplets show a perturbed hydrogen-bond network and evidence for a strong interfacial electric field.

  • Lixue Shi
  • R. Allen LaCour
  • Wei Min
Article19 Mar 2025

elements.title: Electroluminescence and energy transfer mediated by hyperbolic polaritons
elements.contents:
Electroluminescence and energy transfer mediated by hyperbolic polaritons

Far-field mid-infrared spectroscopy reveals both the electroluminescence of hyperbolic phonon polaritons of hexagonal boron nitride excited by strongly biased graphene, and the associated radiative energy transfer through the material.

  • Loubnan Abou-Hamdan
  • Aurélien Schmitt
  • Emmanuel Baudin
Article19 Mar 2025

elements.title: Hyperbolic phonon-polariton electroluminescence in 2D heterostructures
elements.contents:
Hyperbolic phonon-polariton electroluminescence in 2D heterostructures

All-electrical excitation of the hyperbolic phonon polaritons in hexagonal boron nitride by drifting charge carriers in nearby graphene results in electroluminescence at mid-infrared frequencies.

  • Qiushi Guo
  • Iliya Esin
  • Fengnian Xia
Article19 Mar 2025

elements.title: Spatially resolved mapping of cells associated with human complex traits
elements.contents:
Spatially resolved mapping of cells associated with human complex traits

Integration of spatial transcriptomics data with data from genome-wide association studies enables spatially resolved mapping of cells associated with human diseases and other complex traits.

  • Liyang Song
  • Wenhao Chen
  • Jian Yang
ArticleOpen Access19 Mar 2025

elements.title: Oncolytic virus VG161 in refractory hepatocellular carcinoma
elements.contents:
Oncolytic virus VG161 in refractory hepatocellular carcinoma

Results of a multicentre phase 1 clinical trial evaluating treatment with the engineered herpes simplex virus VG161 in advanced liver cancer indicate a good safety profile and promising efficacy.

  • Yinan Shen
  • Xueli Bai
  • Tingbo Liang
Article19 Mar 2025

elements.title: GluA2-containing AMPA receptors form a continuum of Ca2+-permeable channels
elements.contents:
GluA2-containing AMPA receptors form a continuum of Ca2+-permeable channels

GluA2-containing AMPA receptors (AMPARs) are not Ca2+ impermeable, and their ability to transport Ca2+ is shaped by the subunit composition of AMPAR tetramers as well as the orientation of transmembrane AMPAR regulatory proteins and cornichon auxiliary subunits.

  • Federico Miguez-Cabello
  • Xin-tong Wang
  • Derek Bowie
Article19 Mar 2025

elements.title: Global sea-level rise in the early Holocene revealed from North Sea peats
elements.contents:
Global sea-level rise in the early Holocene revealed from North Sea peats

An early Holocene sea-level curve based on data from the North Sea reveals two phases of accelerated sea-level rise owing to meltwater from the North American and Antarctic ice sheets.

  • Marc P. Hijma
  • Sarah L. Bradley
  • Freek S. Busschers
ArticleOpen Access19 Mar 2025

elements.title: Dynamic cytoskeletal regulation of cell shape supports resilience of lymphatic endothelium
elements.contents:
Dynamic cytoskeletal regulation of cell shape supports resilience of lymphatic endothelium

Dynamic cytoskeletal regulation of lymphatic endothelial cell shape, induced by isotropic stretch and crucial for dermal lymphatic capillary function, is identified and found to result from continuous remodelling of cellular overlaps that maintain vessel integrity.

  • Hans Schoofs
  • Nina Daubel
  • Taija Mäkinen
ArticleOpen Access19 Mar 2025
